messages: 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:16): somebody pointed out that there are lots of links to fragments of the ProposedDesignPrinciples document from other parts of the wiki. that gives me pause
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:19): I wonder which people are more comfortable with the "it's a wiki; change it yourself" style vs the mail-changes-to-the-editor style.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:19): the mail-changes-to-the-editor style is more straightforward to manage, in some ways

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:20): just to be arbitrary and capricious, I'll pick on you, 6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e . What do you think about design principles collaboration logistics at this point?

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:23): why are we debating whether alt is required under the subject "Baby Steps or Backwards Steps"? surely "mandating img/@alt" or some such would be better? or "cost-effectiveness of mandating alt attributes on img"
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (00:23): I prefer the latter option (having an editor)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:25): ok, good to know... any other preferences?
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:25): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: for consensus building types of documents like that, it easier to have fewer editors

6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:26): the "ETFW" approach (http://theryanking.com/blog/archives/2006/08/18/etfw/) tends to work better when there's an objective answer to what should be on the page
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:26): ok good. I like it when the universe offers consistent advice.
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:26): like wikipedia
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:27): right; wiki works best when there's a consensus that just needs to be written down
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:28): ok; Anne is on holiday, I gather. 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884, do you know when he gets back?
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:28): wonders why he hasn't bumped into chaals lately

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:29): It seems that Wikipedia fails worst when there isn't an objective answer, and the same would apply to any wiki that doesn't have significantly different editorial rules or culture
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:29): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: in meeting at the moment, will read scrollback later
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:30): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: fwiw, we've taken both approaches with the mf.org wiki
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:30): some areas are mostly "editor only"
6905646aa63b96d6bdfbd256603fa58e (00:30): while others are "anyone can edit"
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:32): tunes into http://webkit.org/blog/
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:32): darn; new stuff there that I haven't seen. why isn't it on planet html5?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (00:34): considering disputes, I'd prefer to have 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 as a gatekeeper instead of anything goes wiki edits
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (00:34): I agree
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:36): hmm... "the block flow child invariant" ... I didn't realize that showed up in rendering code; that makes the HTML 5 constraint seem a little less arbitrary

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:40): hmm.. "We use regression testing to maintain our compatibility gains." , plus Open Source in http://webkit.org/projects/goals.html . I wonder if we can make use of those tests for HTML WG work.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:41): checks the time in japan... 6:41am ... wonders how much of f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb's brain is connected to his IRC client
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (00:44): 's brain is in the shower. (hmmm too much information) in the process of going to Keio

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (00:49): http://www.456bereastreet.com/archive/200708/the_html_5_circus_why_i_left_and_rejoined_the_w3c_html_working_group/ - "I think my energy will be best spent helping to produce documents that are useful to and readable by people who create websites" sounds good
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:51): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: the wiki style was good for brainstorming and initial development, but I think have editors helps in two ways:
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:51): is pretty much sold already
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:51): 1) it doesn't seem to fit well with the w3c process to turn a wiki page directly into a Working Group technical report
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:52): 2) wikis are good for recording information, but not so good for resolving disputes
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (00:52): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: but I am going to do my best to distill the contents of the wiki into usable feedback in any case

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:54): but it seems like the time is now to put something at the top of the wiki page to say "this document is moving out of the wiki; please mail change requests to <email/>" or "... please see _a message about change requests_"
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:56): updates http://www.w3.org/2002/09/wbs/40318/dprv/ to point to http://dev.w3.org/cvsweb/~checkout~/html5/html-design-principles/Overview.html?rev=HEAD
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (00:57): the status of that document should have a pointer back to the wiki copy
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:05): ok, I updated http://www.w3.org/2002/09/wbs/40318/dprv/
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:05): somebody spot check it, please? 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884, a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, ...?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:05): doesn't let me see it
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:05): weird. some people can and some can't
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:06): wonders why his mail server suddenly won't let him send mail
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (01:06): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: looking (though I have another meeting momentarily)
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (01:07): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: can't see it at the moment
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:07): wonders which apple manager to armwrestle for more of 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884's time ;-)
56bb4f4428a296b63ce6f0fc712fd6c4 (01:08): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: it will come naturally - we are near the end of an OS release cycle
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:08): fixed a markup problem in http://www.w3.org/2002/09/wbs/40318/dprv/ ; doubts it helps with the visibility
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:09): try http://www.w3.org/2002/09/wbs/40318/dprv/ again, hixie? I changed the dates so it's open now
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:10): has 15 minutes of brain time available
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:11): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: the descriptions of "agree" and "disagree" sound the same
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:12): if the suggested changes aren't made, agree stays agree but disagree stays disagree
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:12): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: otherwise seems fine
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:12): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: maybe make that clearer
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:12): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: as written, then sounded equivalent
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:13): lacks inspiration for improving clarity; welcomes suggestions
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:15): "11. priniciple "Baby Steps"
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:15): 14. priniciple "Handle Errors"
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:15): Agree should be something like agree with the spirit of the principle but with some changes to the wording
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (01:15): or something like that
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:16): ooops in fact
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:16): it is a lot of them which are called priniciple instead of principle
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:17): danc in the intro, it is said what will be done if there is support, but not what will be done if no support at all.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:19): "Strongly Disagree = No support. Delete it."
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:20): f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb, I'd fix that typo if I could do it all at once, but I don't think I'm going to do umpteen form submissions

587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:21): actually, regarding what will be done with the survey results, nothing is guaranteed/binding: "This survey is a non-binding, informational-gathering excercise"
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:22): yes I have read the non-binding clause.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:23): but I think it will be perceived as
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:23): not mandatory, but if support we might think of publishing it
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:23): not mandatory, but if NO support, we might‚Ä¶  hmm maybe publish it anyway? drop it? keep it on the wiki as non mandatory?
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:24): I say that because the principles are used (too often) as justifications in the discussions, that it makes them a sensitive topic.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:26): is trying to think about an alternative
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:26): brain still foggy I guess
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:26): "too often"? hmm... their main utility is as justification in discussions. if they don't work that way, they should be dropped
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:27): :) yes too often for me ;) I will explain in the review I guess.
f47636673b14c54021a69dc06f6a19fb (01:28): ooops time's up. Train time.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:33): announced the survey
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:35): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: I better not spend two hours tomorrow morning doing WG stuff again
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:35): :)
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:35): that should teach you to claim things are "obvious" ;-)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:35): I expected it to take that long, though
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:36): mainly just checking my thoughts were correct
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:36): it was a helpful and timely summary
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:36): (which, in all but one case, they were)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:36): what parts did you think were too generous?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:48): where is "pave the cowpaths" in the survey?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:51): "Universal Access"/"Separation of Concerns"/"Baby Steps" are inconsistent between survey and CVS too
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:51): yeah just noticed Universal Access missing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:51): that's one of the most important
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:52): somebody on the telcon thought one part was too generous. I don't remember which, a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 . And I haven't read enough mail to say.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:53): sorry about the problems in the survey; I'm struggling to stay in sync.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:54): hunts for current version of cowpaths, universal access...
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:54): http://dev.w3.org/cvsweb/~checkout~/html5/html-design-principles/Overview.html?rev=HEAD#universal-access
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (01:57): does cowpaths look right now?
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (02:00): should I delete baby steps?
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (02:00): it's not in http://dev.w3.org/cvsweb/~checkout~/html5/html-design-principles/Overview.html?rev=HEAD
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (02:02): all better now?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:06): 587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef: Looks like it all matches the CVS copy now
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (02:06): hopes ChrisW doesn't mind that he spent half an hour helping me sync the survey with the wiki and then I undid all that and sync'd with mj's work in cvs.
587bf8b858e15d03428e1415c33c38ef (02:07): gets SIG_FAMILY_TIME
